Understate: The claim underestimates the amount of funding in the American Rescue Plan that is directed towards COVID-19, stating that only 9% is COVID-related when expert analysis shows a higher percentage.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to back up the assertion that 91% of the American Rescue Plan is not COVID-related.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation to the claim, as a significant portion of the bill aims to address the financial fallout caused by the pandemic and is considered COVID-related by experts.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that a significant percentage of the bill is related to COVID-19, as acknowledged by experts.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that only direct funding towards COVID-19 should be considered COVID-related, disregarding the broader economic relief efforts and support for businesses and schools affected by the pandemic.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the lack of COVID-related funding in the American Rescue Plan by stating that 91% of it is not COVID-related, when expert analysis shows a higher percentage of funding directed towards COVID-19.
